meanings.definition: Relating to two musical notes that are the same in pitch but have different names, such as C sharp and D flat.
meanings.sent1: The enharmonic notes C sharp and D flat sound alike.
meanings.sent2: Musicians must understand the enharmonic relationship between C sharp and D flat.
meanings.sent3: The enharmonic twins, C sharp and D flat, always confuse the piano player.
meanings.sent4: In the enharmonic world, C sharp and D flat dance together in harmony.
meanings.sent5: Remember, C sharp and D flat are enharmonic - they share the same pitch but different names.

meanings.definition: A musical interval that is the same in pitch but has different names, such as a diminished second or augmented unison.
meanings.sent1: The enharmonic between C sharp and D flat creates a unique sound.
meanings.sent2: Understanding enharmonics is crucial for music theory students.
meanings.sent3: The enharmonic duo, diminished second and augmented unison, always stick together.
meanings.sent4: In the symphony of music, enharmonics add depth and complexity.
meanings.sent5: The beauty of enharmonics lies in their ability to transform familiar notes into new melodies.
